rComments: Great Prof. Typical image you would put to an English Prof. Fairly generous marker. As long as you do the readings you can pass. Always read his coursepack! That's how you get the A. Very open minded prof.

This professor is really great! I especially enjoyed reading "The Merchant of Venice", and applying it to a newly learned term -- "lawfare"! Initially, I thought I had the least favourable subject of all to present on, but I ended up finding it very fascinating! Personally, I enjoyed the class' deep focus on modernity in Shakespearean lit.
A true scholar. knows a lot about EVERYTHING.   Adorable... a great man all around.

Amazing prof! When people complain about him being too "dry", it's an English class, duh! What do you expect? Multimedia in the classroom? Super intelligent, and really appreciated participation. Great man all around.

Very nice person, and it seems that the more enthusiasm the class has, the more the students enjoy the class.  You have to work hard to get a good mark, don't assume you'll pass if you don't read what's assigned to you. Lectures can be confusing in terms of which points are important.
great prof
Boring lecturer and never sure what's going to be on the exam. Studying for it now, I realize that I have absolutely no idea what's going to be on it.  He's a fair marker though, it seems so far.

Professor is not at all clear in his lectures. Impossible to tell which points are important and which are not. Is this class English or Philosophy? In the lectures, it's hard to tell. Page numbers on syllabus are incorrect and his notes which you are required to buy have older assignments which have not been properly updated.

He seems like such a sweet guy, but for the life of me I can't focus on his lectures. Hands down the most boring class I have ever had. And I try to listen because he seems sooo nice! So far we've only done two small quizzes and I've botched them both. I am usually a straight-A student, but I'm not expecting a good grade with this prof.

I loved this prof. I found the material difficult at times, but once in the exam, I realized I had learned so much more than I thought and ended up acing it. If you are willing to put in the effort to attend class and take good notes, you will do well. History and philosophy are emphasized. The prof's awkwardness and sense of humour are endearing.

You get out of Radloff's class what you're willing to put into it.The man will bend your mind in ways you can't even imagine. That turns me on. Work hard, pay attention. Ask articulate questions and you'll get articulate answers. He's got a great sense of humour, he's easy-going, soft-spoken, and modest. Radloff rocks.

Bernhard is one of the sweetest profs I have ever had. He is definitely awkward but incredibly helpful to those who visit him in office hours. He makes a great coursepack that basically contains his notes on everything, so while his tests are very hard if you actually go to class you can't fail. He is an amazing person once you get to know him!!!
Excellent prof. I took three courses from him and aced everyone.

I really like this guy as a person.He's so adorably awkward, and you can tell he honestly wants the class to be passionate about what he's teaching.But then you get the exam and realize how unreasonable he is. Unless you are a phd student in english literature or came over on the mayflower I don't know how its possible to do well in his class.

Awful! 3 hour lecture of American Lit. is bad enough, but he is SO uninteresting! And his essays are insane, you need a huge number of sources. He seems like a nice person, really, I just think he needs to be a bit LESS consisten (every class is the same) and not expect so much out of 2nd year students.

Good prof, really knows his stuff. Has a way of relating 300-year-old lit to present-day topics. Is making an Obama reference right this minute. If nervous habits bother you, don't take his class. Clears his throat literally every 5 seconds.

I liked Radloff's seminar quite a lot - the material was terribly difficult, even borderline incomprehensible, but Radloff went out of his way to make it very clear, and also graded very appropriately. I thought I would flunk the class based on the difficulty of the material, but he made himself totally available and was able to guide me to an A-

Never take a 3 hour class with this guy. He made american lit worse than my canadian lit course. He is as bland as a saltless rice cake. You laugh at his jokes because your so bored, that they seem funny. I have to say though his course pack is excellent for when your studying. Also his 7 page literature essays require 10 sources which is insane.

Obviously a very intelligent man, and seems like a nice guy, but not cut out for teaching.  Between his unclear marking criteria, lack of commentary on assignments, and the rather dry, monotonous, convoluted content of the lectures, this course is going to ruin my previously excellent GPA.
An excellent teacher and very friendly and approachable
Makes poetry come alive. Excellent motivator to read more American literature to better understand our neighbours to the South

altho he is monotone and textbooky, he seems like such a sweet guy just trying to do his job and tell us about american lit. if u follow what he is saying u wont have a hard time. he likes when ppl laugh with him and his vocab becomes more colloquial since he's relaxed...quiet guy but one of the better profs...even tho he looks stern:)
This professor was very spacey...
In addition to being a top Heidegger scholar, Radloff is an extremely kind, helpful prof.  His summaries and schemes come in very handy when grappling with a particularly challenging text.

BEST ENGLISH PROFESSOR at the UNIVERSITY HANDS DOWN!  Ask him about Derrida or Heidegger and you won't be disappointed (he knows his philosophy!).  All you have to remember for his American Literature classes is three words: Emerson, Emerson, Emerson (or perhaps Ralph Waldo Emerson..).  Very dry and funny sometimes.  GO RADLOFF!

Bernhard is charming and funny in his own way. He genuinely appreciates it when you laugh at his jokes. The material is hard, but if you pay close attention, passing is no problem. To do extra well, visit him in office hrs and he'll tell you EXACTLY what he looks for in assignments. Werd!

i love radloff. his humor is not for everyone... but he is very helpful, a fair marker and overall a good prof. i dislike the all-lecture style; he could perhaps incorperate some sort of class discussion.
One of my best classes. Prof has great sense of dry ironic humour. Students should wake up and listen
Extremely intelligent, but a bad teacher.  He is very unclear, and an exceptionally hard marker.  I am not a lazy student but he still gave me the worst mark I've ever received in university.
Very good prof.Fascinating presentation of the material including American religion and political backgrounds to literature. Makes you think. Not for lazy students.
Hmmm...monotone to the max, unclear to the max, unorganized to the max. BUT he takes attendance at the beginning of class and couldnt care less if you leave 2 minutes after....hURRAH!
he fell off the desk. but he grades easy.
Cannot convey his ideas properly.  Horrible lecture format.
This prof knows what he's talking about and conveys it effectively although slightly monotone. He's more enjoyable when he livens up a bit. The class does require work, but that's why you're here.
Worst prof I ever had. Also, totally unhelpful. I agree with the person who said he was speaking Russian rather than English... Word up my brother!
cool guy, fascinating material

Radloff is obviously a brilliant man.  He may not convey the lectures as effectively as other profs, but his marking is fair (if your grammar as an English student is good..which it should be)He's approachable and helpful when approached.

'Unhelpful' is a harsh term. His explanations can be convoluted, but he presents an information that (surprise, people!) leaves it to the student to figure it out. Think for yourselves people. That's why we're here, right? Funny guy, on top of that. G
Genius but BORRING
Course strongly based on philosophy: extrememly difficult texts and essays.Hard marker, but not unapproachable when asking for help.Great scholar, not the greatest prof.

Overly hard marker. Brilliant but can't express what he is trying to teach. You'll leave the class wondering if he was speaking ENGLISH or Russian. Not helpful when you ask a question either, he repeats the same thing over instead of helping you!
No Comments
No Comments
His lectures lack comprehension. A horrid marker.

His lectures are unhelpful and unfocused. He may be an 'brilliant' scholar, but he is not an effective professor. He's also a hard marker and takes attendance. I wouldn't recommend taking the criticism class with him.
